oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed Circular Letter No. 4 from the Confederate Post Office in Montgomery, Alabama, announcing that it is taking over postal service from the United States Government.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Post-Office Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Post Office Department of the Confederate States of America was established on February 21, 1861. Jefferson Davis appointed John Henninger Reagan, a former U. S. Congressman, to be Postmaster General of the Confederate States. In May 1861, Reagan issued a proclamation stating that he would officially assume control of the postal service of the Confederate States on June 1, 1861.
